medium_description_en: Determines stroke risk in patients with atrial fibrillation.

seo.meta_description_en: The ATRIA Stroke Risk Score determines stroke risk in patients with atrial fibrillation.

how_to_use.use_case_en:
• Patients with atrial fibrillation with potential bleeding risks to help quantify stroke risk.
  • Patients who are apprehensive about anticoagulation to better understand their stroke risk.
how_to_use.why_use_en: The ATRIA Stroke Risk score, like the CHA2DS2-VASc Score can help objectify stroke risk, and perform better than the more well-known CHADS2 Score.

next_steps.advice_en: Patients should be evaluated for bleeding risk before initiating anticoagulation; risk of bleeding can be estimated using the HAS-BLED Score for Major Bleeding Risk or several other scores.

about.formula_en: Addition of the selected points; points assigned below:
about.more_info_en:
Criteria Points without previous Stroke Points with Previous Stroke
Age (Years) ≥85 +6 +9
75 to 84 +5 +7
65 to 74 +3 +7
<65 +0 +8
Sex Female +1 +1
Male 0 0
Comorbidities Diabetes +1 +1
CHF +1 +1
Hypertension +1 +1
Proteinuria +1 +1
eGFR<45 or ESRD +1 +1

Scoring

  • Low risk of stroke (<1%): 0-5 points
  • Intermediate risk of stroke (1-<2%): 6 points
  • High risk of stroke (≥2%): >6 points

Original/Primary Reference.text: Singer DE, Chang Y, et. al. A new risk scheme to predict ischemic stroke and other thromboembolism in atrial fibrillation: the ATRIA studystroke risk score. J Am Heart Assoc. 2013 Jun 21;2(3):e000250. doi: 10.1161/JAHA.113.000250.

Other References.text: Mary Ann Moon. New Risk Scheme to Predict Stroke in AF. Internal Medicine News Digital Network. 9/29/2014.

creator_info.about_en: Daniel Singer, MD, is a professor of medicine at Harvard Medical School and professor in the Department of Epidemiology at Harvard School of Public Health. He is also chief of the Clinical Epidemiology Unit in the General Medicine Division at Massachusetts General Hospital (MGH). Dr. Singer is internationally recognized for his research on prevention of stroke in atrial fibrillation (AF).
